meanings.definition: Making or causing a harsh, discordant sound.
meanings.sent1: The janglier music made my ears hurt.
meanings.sent2: The wind chimes produced a janglier sound in the breeze.
meanings.sent3: The janglier alarm clock woke me up with a start.
meanings.sent4: Her janglier laughter echoed through the empty hallway.
meanings.sent5: The janglier clash of cymbals signaled the start of the performance.

meanings.definition: A person or thing that jangles.
meanings.sent1: The keys on the janglier keychain were hard to miss.
meanings.sent2: The tambourine player was the janglier in the band.
meanings.sent3: The janglier of the bells added a festive touch to the celebration.
meanings.sent4: She was known as the janglier in the office for her noisy jewelry.
meanings.sent5: The janglier of the doorbell announced the arrival of guests.

meanings.definition: To make a harsh, discordant sound.
meanings.sent1: The metal gate would janglier whenever it was opened.
meanings.sent2: The pots and pans janglier loudly as she dropped them in the sink.
meanings.sent3: The old car would janglier whenever it hit a bump in the road.
meanings.sent4: His voice seemed to janglier in frustration as he argued with his friend.
meanings.sent5: The wind caused the loose shutters to janglier all night long.
